llama2_direct_sole-planning_results:
Of course! I'd be happy to help you plan your week-long trip in Illinois. Based on your preferences, here's a suggested itinerary for visiting three unique cities in Illinois from March 20th to March 26th, 2022:

Day 1 (March 20th): Eau Claire to Rockford

* Distance: 392 km (approximately 4 hours and 45 minutes by car)
* Accommodation: Visitors permitted at the Hampton Inn & Suites Rockford
* Local American cuisine: Try some delicious BBQ at Smokin' Joe's Barbecue Restaurant
* Chinese cuisine: Enjoy some authentic Chinese dishes at China King Buffet
* French cuisine: Indulge in some delectable French-inspired fare at La Brioche Bakery & Cafe
* Italian cuisine: Savor some mouthwatering pasta and pizza at Pizzeria Urbana

Day 2 (March 21st): Rockford to Peoria

* Distance: 269 km (approximately 4 hours by car)
* Accommodation: Visitors permitted at the Embassy Suites Peoria
* Local American cuisine: Check out the iconic Pork Chop Sandwich at The Landing Restaurant
* Chinese cuisine: Enjoy some tasty stir-fries and noodles at Happy Buddha
* French cuisine: Delight in some decadent crepes at Creperie La Baguette
* Italian cuisine: Savor some satisfying Italian dishes at Il Lirico

Day 3 (March 22nd): Peoria to Chicago

* Distance: 130 km (approximately 2 hours and 45 minutes by car)
* Accommodation: Visitors permitted at the Hyatt Regency Chicago
* Local American cuisine: Don't miss out on some mouth-watering deep-dish pizza at Pizzeria Uno
* Chinese cuisine: Indulge in some delicious dim sum at Jade Palace
* French cuisine: Enjoy some exquisite escargots and other French fare at Le Français
* Italian cuisine: Savor some scrumptious pasta dishes at La Bella Vita

Day 4 (March 23rd): Chicago

* Accommodation: Visitors permitted at the Hotel Essex, Autograph Collection
* Local American cuisine: Try some iconic Chicago-style hot dogs at Portillo's
* Chinese cuisine: Enjoy some delectable Chinese food at Happy Buddha
* French cuisine: Indulge in some mouthwatering escargots and other French fare at Le Français
* Italian cuisine: Savor some satisfying pasta dishes at La Bella Vita

Day 5 (March 24th): Chicago to Eau Claire

* Distance: 130 km (approximately 2 hours and 45 minutes by car)
* Accommodation: Visitors permitted at the Hampton Inn & Suites Eau Claire
* Local American cuisine: Check out the mouth-watering BBQ at Smokin' Joe's Barbecue Restaurant
* Chinese cuisine: Enjoy some tasty stir-fries and noodles at Happy Buddha
* French cuisine: Delight in some decadent crepes at Creperie La Baguette
* Italian cuisine: Savor some satisfying pasta dishes at Il Lirico

Day 6 (March 25th): Eau Claire

* Accommodation: Visitors permitted at the Holiday Inn Express Eau Claire
* Local American cuisine: Try some delicious BBQ at Smokin' Joe's Barbecue Restaurant
* Chinese cuisine: Enjoy some tasty stir-fries and noodles at Happy Buddha
* French cuisine: Indulge in some mouthwatering crepes at Creperie La Baguette
* Italian cuisine: Savor some satisfying pasta dishes at Il Lirico

Day 7 (March 26th): Departure from Eau Claire

* Distance: N/A
* Accommodation: N/A

Budget Breakdown:

* Transportation: $1,500 (based on a rental car for the duration of the trip)
* Accommodations: $3,500 (based on an average price of $100 per night for 3 nights in each city)
* Food and Beverage: $2,000 (based on an average price of $20 per meal x 10 meals per day x 7 days)
Total: $7,000

Note: The budget breakdown is an estimate and may vary based on individual preferences and exchange rates.

I hope this helps you plan your trip to Illinois!
